details.behavior: The defendant, M. Cooper, improperly supervised the construction site at 45, Elm Street, Ashland, leading to improperly secured scaffolding.
details.evidence: Site inspection reports, photographs of the unsecured scaffolding, and testimony from the site safety officer.

details.behavior: The defendant ignored multiple warnings regarding the stability of the scaffolding and failed to take corrective actions.
details.evidence: Email correspondence from the project engineer, recorded phone calls, and witness testimonies from three construction workers.

details.behavior: The unstable scaffolding collapsed, causing the death of a worker named J. Harris.
details.evidence: Autopsy report, death certificate, and security camera footage depicting the collapse.

judgmentResult.sentencingConsiderations: Although the negligence was substantial, the court took into account M. Cooper's clean prior record and eventual cooperation with the investigation.
